data.name: Corner
data.does: Social place map, curate & share lists, collaborative lists, import from IG/TikTok, AI vibe search, follow friends, social feed, natural language discovery (v5.0)
gap: Algorithm-driven recs alongside social — not purely trust-based
Community and content US/Gen Z-centric — available in KSA but no Arabic or local density
Pre-revenue with no clear monetization path — iOS only
extra: Founded by Eliza Wu (ex-JPMorgan, Pantheon Ventures $89B fund) and Jake Xia (engineer, AWS CTO Fellow)
Imports Instagram/TikTok links into map pins — closest feature overlap with etch
275K+ user-contributed places across 450+ cities — all hand-picked, no scraped data
NYC-based team of 8 — published physical zines of top user-curated spots in SF

data.name: Roamy
data.does: Import places from social media, AI trip planning, community trips
gap: Community limited to Discord — no in-app social graph
extra: Closest direct competitor — imports saved posts into map pins
iOS only with shared group trip planning (added late 2025)
Relies heavily on UGC creator marketing across TikTok

data.name: Mapstr
data.does: Personal place mapping, follow friends, collaborative maps, mapStore creator marketplace, imports from Foursquare/Swarm/Google Maps
gap: Free tier limited to 300 places — paywall at $80/yr
No social media video import (imports from Foursquare/Swarm/Google Maps only)
French-centric community — limited global and MENA reach
extra: 3M+ users globally with follow system, collaborative maps, and creator marketplace (mapStore)
Freemium model — free up to 300 places, $80/yr for unlimited (Mapstr Plus)
Launched Mapstr Matching (AI-based recommendations) in 2024

data.name: Swarm
data.does: Check-ins, mayorships, gamified lifelogging, friend activity
gap: Check-in focused — no curation or organizing tools
Gamification-driven (mayorships, badges) — different core behavior from saving places
extra: Foursquare shut down its City Guide app in Dec 2024 to focus on Swarm
Parent company pivoted to enterprise data/API — Swarm is consumer-facing arm
Academic research confirms active check-in culture in Riyadh: food venue check-ins showed highest sharing engagement in KSA (ResearchGate, 2017)
Kaggle dataset of Foursquare venues in Riyadh further validates local usage

data.name: Places
data.downloadNote: iOS only · invite-only, ~115 App Store reviews
data.does: Expert-curated places from Michelin chefs, designers, and cultural figures
gap: No social media import or personal curation
extra: Built by Raya (exclusive dating app) team — founder Daniel Gendelman
Curators include chefs, architects, and cultural figures like Olivia Wilde
Launched 'Table Tonight' (Jan 2026) — same-day restaurant reservation aggregator

data.name: AllTrails
data.does: Trail discovery, community reviews, curated collections, 60M+ users
extra: Won Apple App of the Year in 2023
Acquired by Permira (PE) for $150M in 2021 — valued at ~$1B+
60M+ registered users with ~$9.1M net app revenue in 2024

data.name: Wanderlog
data.does: Trip planning, itinerary building, collaborative docs
extra: Y Combinator W19 batch — $1.65M seed from General Catalyst
7.4M monthly web visits — actively maintained (last updated Jan 2026)

data.name: Michelin Guide
data.does: Expert-curated restaurant & hotel discovery, bookings via Resy/OpenTable
gap: Limited to fine dining, not everyday spots
extra: First time entire global guide exists in one app — launched 2020
Includes Michelin stars, Bib Gourmand, and hotel selections across 130+ countries
Free app with 'Plus' membership for VIP hotel upgrades and concierge

data.name: Time to Momo
data.does: Expert local-curated city guides, walking routes, hotel bookings, 50+ European cities
gap: Paid editorial model (€12–20/city) — not user-generated or social
European/Dutch-centric — no MENA or global reach
No social layer, no community, no import features
extra: Rotterdam-based, founded by Mart Evers — market leader in Netherlands/Belgium for city trip guides
Locals-as-curators model: each city guide written by residents who know the neighborhoods
Revenue from paid app routes (€11.99/city), print guides (€19.99), and hotel booking commissions

data.name: TikTok
data.does: Massive place discovery via video, travel content, restaurant recs
gap: Where users discover places, but can't organize or act on them
extra: 1.6B monthly active users — #1 discovery platform for Gen Z
644M downloads in 2025 alone

data.name: Instagram
data.does: Discovery, inspiration, saves, collections, endless scroll
gap: Saved posts have no structure — users lose track of places
extra: 3B monthly active users across all markets
~52M new downloads per month

data.name: Google Maps
data.does: Navigation, business listings, reviews, saved lists
extra: 2B+ monthly active users globally
$11.1B in revenue (2023) — primarily ads and enterprise
Tried social features (follow system, community feed) but removed them in Sept 2025

data.name: TripAdvisor
data.does: Reviews, rankings, tourist discovery — pivoting to experiences and membership
extra: $1.8B revenue in 2024 with 150M unique users and ~900M registered accounts
Rebranded in 2025 (25th anniversary) — pivoting to 'experience-led' model, cut 20% workforce
Launched AI-powered Tripadvisor app within ChatGPT (Nov 2025)

data.name: Wafy
data.does: Events, experiences, tourism content in Saudi Arabia
extra: Jeddah-based, focused on events and experiences in KSA — aligned with Vision 2030
Claims to be KSA's most trusted content aggregator for tourism and entertainment

data.name: Jahez
data.does: Delivery services, restaurant listings, ordering — transactional layer
extra: IPO'd on Tadawul — $1.2B market cap, 32% delivery market share in KSA
3.9M active users (H1 2024), expanding to Kuwait and Bahrain
Net profit SAR 188M in 2024 — up 50% YoY

changes.context: Market cap dropped ~32% following weak Q4 2025 earnings, ongoing "experience-led" pivot, and 20% workforce reduction. Stock hit 52-week low at ~$10.06.
Market cap fell ~37% to SAR 2.85B as stock dropped 58% YoY despite strong revenue growth (+24.3% YoY). Regional delivery market under pressure from competition.
Alphabet market cap surged from $2.1T to $3.76T (+79%), driven by AI momentum, strong cloud revenue, and Search dominance. Removed social features from Maps in Sept 2025.
ByteDance valuation rose from ~$500B to ~$550B based on General Atlantic secondary share sale in early 2026. TikTok remains #1 discovery platform for Gen Z.
Meta market cap rose ~8% from $1.5T to $1.62T, supported by strong ad revenue growth and continued Instagram Reels engagement.
Instagram following grew from 3.8M to 4M (+200K), reflecting continued expansion of Michelin Guide coverage and digital engagement strategy.
Instagram following grew from 70.3K to 72K, steady organic growth through creator marketing on TikTok.
Instagram following ticked from 38K to 39K. No major product or funding changes detected.
User count grew from 60M to 65M (+8%). Updated description to reflect broader community positioning.
